page.title: 07HINDHAY FARM, MAIDENHEAD.
page.content: Hindhay Farm is really an arable farm, which means that they mainly grow crops, however, they also keep some live-stock. We were shown around the farm by Nigel Findlay. The total acreage of the farm is 380 acres, which is used as follows: Winter wheat 200 acres Spring barley 20 acres Winter barley 100 acres Potatoes 50 acres Grass 10 acres. The farm keeps both cows and bullocks. There are four bullocks, which are a Fresian and Hereford cross. They only have a small herd of twelve cows, they are also a Fresian and Hereford cross. Hindhay Farm also works with the farm next door, Pinkneys Farm.
